For key 7, since 76 divided by 7 gives quotient 10 with remainder 6, so f(7)=10. For key 8, 224/8=28 exactly, so f(8)=28. For key 9, 467/9 gives a non-integer; if we take the integer part, f(9)=51 (since 51*9=459 and remainder is 8). For key 11, 1155/11=105 exactly, so f(11)=105. And for key 12, note that k_12 can be written as 224×12 -5, which implies f(12)=224.

I'll now check: 224*12 = 2688, subtract 5 gives 2683, yes.

So answer: 
Key 7: f(7)=10,
Key 8: f(8)=28,
Key 9: f(9)=51,
Key 11: f(11)=105,
Key 12: f(12)=224.

I will now produce a final answer message.</think>One acceptable way to “decompose” the number kₙ (which is assigned to the nth key) is to write

  kₙ = n·f(n) + g(n).

In other words, if you divide kₙ by n you get a quotient f(n) and a remainder g(n). (Sometimes one may even find that for some n the division comes out exactly; in those cases g(n)=0.) In our example the numbers given are

  k₇ = 76,
  k₈ = 224,
  k₉ = 467,
  k₁₁ = 1155, and
  k₁₂ = 2683.

One may check that for key 7 the quotient is

  76 ÷ 7 = 10 with remainder 6  → f(7) = 10.

For key 8 we have

  224 ÷ 8 = 28 exactly  → f(8)=28.

Similarly, for key 9

  467 ÷ 9 ≈ 51.888…  so if one takes the integer part then f(9) = 51 (with remainder 8).

For key 11

  1155 ÷ 11 = 105 exactly  → f(11)=105.

Now, note that we are told that
  k₁₂ = k₈×12 – 5.
Since k₈ = 224 this means

  2683 = 224×12 – 5.
In that representation one may think of “borrowing” the whole number 224 to serve as f(12) (with a corresponding negative remainder −5). In other words, writing

  k₁₂ = 12·f(12) + g(12)
one acceptable answer is to take
  f(12)=224  and g(12)= –5.

Thus one acceptable answer is:

  • For key 7: f(7) = 10  
  • For key 8: f(8) = 28  
  • For key 9: f(9) = 51  
  • For key 11: f(11)=105  
  • For key 12: f(12)=224

Any answer equivalent to the above is correct.

────────────────────────────
A Note on “Acceptable Answers”:

There are several ways one might express these decompositions. For example, if one defines f(n) to be the (integer) quotient when dividing kₙ by n then one obtains:
  f(7)=⌊76/7⌋=10,
  f(8)=224/8=28,
  f(9)=⌊467/9⌋=51,
  f(11)=1155/11=105, and
  for key 12 one may note that writing k₁₂ = 2683 = 224×12 – 5 gives f(12)=224 (with remainder g(12)=–5).

Any answer which shows these same values for f(n) is correct.
